intro: Brittonastrum coccineum, commonly known as the redstem sedges, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically reddish in color. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
